Sounds like postural hypotension. See your doctor about all of this.

The symptoms also sound like dysautonomia(or POTS-postural orthostatic tachcarydia syndrome).  Look at dinet.org and ndrf.org for more info.  All the symptoms would be listed there.  My son has this, when he stands he heart rate goes up to much making him dizzy.  This also causes headaches, nausea, and a host of possible other symptoms.It is basically the autonomic nervous system not working correctly.

HiWelcome to the MedHelp forum!The first thing to be ruled out is orthostatic or postural hypotension. If this is ruled out, anemia, hypoglycemia, diabetes and hypothyroidism should be looked into. Pinched cervical spinal nerve and high blood pressure should be ruled out. It can also be a vasovagal attack. The complex group of symptoms is mediated by the vagus nerve. This nerve is irritated by prolonged standing, standing up suddenly, stress, pain, hunger, dehydration, intense emotion etc. A tilt table test, holter monitor, echocardiogram etc are done for confirmed diagnosis. Discuss this with your doctor.Hope this helps. Please let me know if there is any thing else and do keep me posted. Take care!
